title: Thesauras capability
description:
I would like Lucene to be able to add terms to a search automatically through a
thesauras lookup.

comments.content:
This is not a bug, but rather a feature request.  We keep those in a TODO file
in the CVS repository.  We don't use Bugzilla for this.

Also, one developer did mention that he may develop a component that would use A
Thesaurus to look up synonyms.

There is no ETA on that, but you are welcome to inquire on lucene-dev mailing list.
comments.author: Otis Gospodnetic

comments.content:
I opened this as an enhancement request, not as a bug, as anyone can clearly see
from the severity being set to "Enchancment".  Based on the below text, which
comes directly from the Jakarta project site, this is supposed to be the
mechanism to request feature enhancements.  I recieved one e-mail saying that
one of my bugs was closed, because you use a TODO list in CVS for enhancements.
 I know that Lucene hasn't been a Jakarta project for very long, but since it
is, it should follow established Jakarta project methods for such a thing.  I
find it much easier to request a feature enhancement through the standard
Jakarta mechanism, because I can use to track my requests against the project. 
If you want to add my request to the TODO list in CVS from here that is fine,
but I would like to track this through this request.

Pier Fumagalli has set up the Apache Bug Database. Please use this database
report bugs and suggest new features. To suggest a new feature, set the severity
of the bug to "enhancement".

Thanks.
comments.author: Andrig T. Miller

comments.content:
Your request is precisely what custom Analyzers are all about.  The core of Lucene supports this 
flexibly, so thesaurus lookup is possible.  This feature is not something that should be included 
into the core, but rather as an extension.  We have a Lucene sandbox CVS repository for just such 
customizations - will we see your contribution there soon?!
comments.author: Erik Hatcher

comments.content:
Okay.  I believe I understand the rationale for not including this in the core.
 We will write it ourselves.

Thanks.
comments.author: Andrig T. Miller
